bibl.title: Incubation at Saqqâra.

series.title: American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition

bibl.note: The subject discussed in this article will be dealt with more fully in a book now in preparation, tentatively entitled Where Dreams May Come: Incubation Sanctuaries in the Greco-Roman World. - The evidence for incubation at Saqqâra [including inscriptions] is less abundant and more complex than previously recognized.

bibl.title: Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007

bibl.seg: RENBERG Gil H., Incubation at Saqqâra.

Traianos GAGOS (Editor), Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007 = American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition (Ann Arbor, 2010) pp. 649-662.

The subject discussed in this article will be dealt with more fully in a book now in preparation, tentatively entitled Where Dreams May Come: Incubation Sanctuaries in the Greco-Roman World. - The evidence for incubation at Saqqâra [including inscriptions] is less abundant and more complex than previously recognized.
